result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric John Sobczak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with 94 days credit, CONSECUTIVE to Count 4 and any other sentence.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.

Random urine screens.
Conditions apply to ALL counts.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric John Sobczak in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Counts 3, 4 and 5:    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Counts 1 and 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read in. Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Phillip D
As to Count 3:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  2 YEARS with 94 days credit CONSECUTIVE to Count 4;  the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 MONTHS.
As to Count 4:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  2 YEARS  CONSECUTIVE to Count 5;  the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 MONTHS.
As to Count 5:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  2 YEARS;  the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 MONTHS.
These sentences are CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on 4 YEARS probation pursuant to 973.09(2)(ar)

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision:
- No contact with Phillip D, his family, his home or his businesses
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- 100 hours of community service
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol. No possession of drug paraphenalia
- referral to the mental health unit
- mental health treatment and counseling
- take prescribed medications
- Random urine screens.
- no weapons
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court orders the Clerks office to provide a JOC and psychological evaluation to the Probation Department

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1200.00 to Lucia D; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA surcharge on Count 3 only;  Court waives the DNA surcharges on Counts 4 & 5 due to the DNA surcharge assessed on Count 3;
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied
If defendant is incarcarated:  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
